events.message: The policyholder reported a car collision that occurred yesterday afternoon at an intersection, requesting to initiate a claim for damages.
The claim has been categorized under Auto Accident after review of the initial report mentioning vehicle collision and damage.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to the case to provide dedicated assistance to the policyholder.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the claimant that the process will proceed promptly.
The claimant was asked to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and a repair estimate to further investigate the claim.
All requested documents including the police report, multiple photos, and official repair estimates were submitted by the claimant.
The claims investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents and arranging for an onsite vehicle inspection.
Investigators completed their assessment confirming the details of the accident and validated the claim for coverage.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant covering repair costs minus the deductible, as per policy terms.
The policyholder expressed satisfaction with the timely communication and the proposed settlement amount.
The claim was officially approved by the claims manager following agreement on the settlement terms.
Claim settlement payment was issued via electronic transfer to the policyholderâ€™s bank account promptly.
The claim file was closed after full settlement and confirmation that the claimant received payment without issues.
The case was archived in the insurance database for future reference and compliance auditing purposes.
